summary.span: 表示任意大、帶正負號的整數。

span.span: Represents an arbitrarily large signed integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類型是不可變的類型表示任意大整數，其值在理論上沒有上限或下限。The type is an immutable type that represents an arbitrarily large integer whose value in theory has no upper or lower bounds. 成員型別極為相似的其他整數類資料類型 ( ， ， ， ， ， ， ，和類型)。The members of the type closely parallel those of other integral types (the , , , , , , , and types). 此型別不同於其他整數類資料類型中[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]，其具有所指定的範圍及其`MinValue`和`MaxValue`屬性。This type differs from the other integral types in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], which have a range indicated by their `MinValue` and `MaxValue` properties. > [!NOTE] > 因為型別是不可變 (請參閱[可變動性和 BigInteger 結構](#mutability))，因為它有沒有上限或下限的界限，可能會導致任何作業中擲回太成長值大型。Because the type is immutable (see [Mutability and the BigInteger Structure](#mutability)) and because it has no upper or lower bounds, an can be thrown for any operation that causes a value to grow too large. ## BigInteger 物件具現化Instantiating a BigInteger Object 您可以具現化物件以數種方式：You can instantiate a object in several ways: - 您可以使用`new`關鍵字，並做為參數提供的任何整數或浮點值建構函式。You can use the `new` keyword and provide any integral or floating-point value as a parameter to the constructor. (浮點數的值會被截斷，才能指派給。)下列範例說明如何使用`new`關鍵字來具現化值。(Floating-point values are truncated before they are assigned to the .) The following example illustrates how to use the `new` keyword to instantiate values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#1)] - 您可以宣告變數並指派值，就像您一樣任何數值類型，只要該值是整數型別。You can declare a variable and assign it a value just as you would any numeric type, as long as that value is an integral type. 下列範例會使用指派來建立值從。The following example uses assignment to create a value from an . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#2)] - 您可以指派十進位或浮點數的值給物件，如果您將值轉換，或先將它轉換。You can assign a decimal or floating-point value to a object if you cast the value or convert it first. 下列範例明確轉換 （在 C# 中)，或將轉換 （在 Visual Basic)並值。The following example explicitly casts (in C#) or converts (in Visual Basic) a and a value to a . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#3)] 這些方法可讓您具現化物件，其值為其中一個現有的數字的範圍中的類型才。These methods enable you to instantiate a object whose value is in the range of one of the existing numeric types only. 您可以具現化物件，其值可能會超過三種方式之一中的現有數值類型的範圍：You can instantiate a object whose value can exceed the range of the existing numeric types in one of three ways: - 您可以使用`new`關鍵字，並提供任何大小的位元組陣列建構函式。You can use the `new` keyword and provide a byte array of any size to the constructor. 例如：For example: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#4)] - 您可以呼叫或是方法，將轉換的數字的字串表示。You can call the or methods to convert the string representation of a number to a . 例如：For example: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#5)] - 您可以呼叫`static`(`Shared` Visual Basic 中)方法，執行數值運算式上的某項作業，並傳回導出結果。You can call a `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) method that performs some operation on a numeric expression and returns a calculated result. 下列範例會藉由 cube並指派結果。The following example does this by cubing and assigning the result to a . [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#6)] 未初始化的值是。The uninitialized value of a is . ## BigInteger 值上執行的作業Performing Operations on BigInteger Values 您可以使用像您使用任何其他整數類資料類型執行個體。You can use a instance as you would use any other integral type. 可讓您執行基本數學運算，例如加法、 減法、 部門、 乘法、 減法、 負號、 和一元負運算的標準數值運算子會多載。 overloads the standard numeric operators to enable you to perform basic mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, subtraction, negation, and unary negation. 您也可以使用標準數值運算子比較兩個彼此的值。You can also use the standard numeric operators to compare two values with each other. 像其他整數類資料類型，也支援 位元`And`， `Or`， `XOr`，左 shift 鍵和向右移位運算子。Like the other integral types, also supports the bitwise `And`, `Or`, `XOr`, left shift, and right shift operators. 語言不支援自訂運算子結構也會提供用於執行數學運算的對等方法。For languages that do not support custom operators, the structure also provides equivalent methods for performing mathematical operations. 其中包括， ， ， ， ，和其他許多選項。These include , , , , , and several others. 許多成員的結構會直接對應至整數類資料類型的成員。Many members of the structure correspond directly to members of the other integral types. 颾魤 ㄛ新增成員，如下所示：In addition, adds members such as the following: - 它會傳回值，表示正負號的值。, which returns a value that indicates the sign of a value. - 它會傳回數值的絕對值值。, which returns the absolute value of a value. - 它會傳回商數及除法運算的餘數。, which returns both the quotient and remainder of a division operation. - 它會傳回兩個最大公因數值。, which returns the greatest common divisor of two values. 許多這些額外的成員對應至的成員類別，可提供基本數值類型所使用的功能。Many of these additional members correspond to the members of the class, which provides the functionality to work with the primitive numeric types. ## 可變動性和 BigInteger 結構Mutability and the BigInteger Structure 下列範例會具現化物件，然後逐一遞增其值。The following example instantiates a object and then increments its value by one. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#1)] 雖然此範例中會出現來修改現有值，但這不是物件的如此。Although this example appears to modify the value of the existing object, this is not the case. 物件是不可變的這表示在內部，common language runtime 實際上會建立新物件，並將其指派的值大於其先前的值。 objects are immutable, which means that internally, the common language runtime actually creates a new object and assigns it a value one greater than its previous value. 然後會將這個新物件傳回給呼叫者。This new object is then returned to the caller. > [!NOTE] > .NET Framework 中的其他數值類型也是不可變的。The other numeric types in the .NET Framework are also immutable. 不過，因為類型沒有沒有上限或下限的界限，其值可以變得非常大，對效能造成可觀的衝擊。However, because the type has no upper or lower bounds, its values can grow extremely large and have a measurable impact on performance. 雖然此程序是呼叫端透明的就會產生對效能帶來負面影響。Although this process is transparent to the caller, it does incur a performance penalty. 在某些情況下，尤其是當重複的作業將會在迴圈中上非常大值，該效能產生負面影響可能更為顯著。In some cases, especially when repeated operations are performed in a loop on very large values, that performance penalty can be significant. 例如，在下列範例中，作業回應達百萬次和值都會加一每次作業成功。For example, in the following example, an operation is performed repetitively up to a million times, and a value is incremented by one every time the operation succeeds. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#12)] 在此情況下，您可以改善效能，藉由執行的所有中繼指派變數。In such a case, you can improve performance by performing all intermediate assignments to an variable. 最後一個變數的值再指派給迴圈結束時的物件。The final value of the variable can then be assigned to the object when the loop exits. 下列範例提供一個實例。The following example provides an illustration. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/cs/Mutability_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.Mutability/vb/Mutability_Examples.vb#3)] ## 使用位元組陣列與十六進位字串Working with Byte Arrays and Hexadecimal Strings 如果您將轉換值為位元組陣列，或如果您將轉換的位元組陣列，以值，您必須考慮的位元組順序。If you convert values to byte arrays, or if you convert byte arrays to values, you must consider the order of bytes. 結構會預期要有個別的位元組才會出現在 little-endian 順序的位元組陣列 （也就是低序位位元組值的前面的高序位位元組）。The structure expects the individual bytes in a byte array to appear in little-endian order (that is, the lower-order bytes of the value precede the higher-order bytes). 您可以往返值，藉由呼叫方法，然後再將傳遞產生的位元組陣列建構函式，如下列範例所示。You can round-trip a value by calling the method and then passing the resulting byte array to the constructor, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#1)] 若要具現化值，您可以從位元組陣列，代表某些其他整數類資料類型的值，傳遞將整數值方法，然後再產生的位元組陣列的傳遞建構函式。To instantiate a value from a byte array that represents a value of some other integral type, you can pass the integral value to the method, and then pass the resulting byte array to the constructor. 下列範例會具現化值從位元組陣列，表示值。The following example instantiates a value from a byte array that represents an value. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#2)] 結構假設，負值會儲存使用二補數表示。The structure assumes that negative values are stored by using two's complement representation. 因為結構代表數值，但是沒有固定的長度，建構函式一律會解譯為正負號位元陣列中的最後一個位元組的最大顯著性位元。Because the structure represents a numeric value with no fixed length, the constructor always interprets the most significant bit of the last byte in the array as a sign bit. 若要避免從令人困惑的二補數表示負值正值，正值的正負號和大小表示的建構函式中的值的最高有效位元的位元組陣列中的最後一個位元組一般被視為集合應該包含額外的位元組，其值為 0。To prevent the constructor from confusing the two's complement representation of a negative value with the sign and magnitude representation of a positive value, positive values in which the most significant bit of the last byte in the byte array would ordinarily be set should include an additional byte whose value is 0. 比方說，0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 是-1,000,000 或 4,293,967,296 由小到大十六進位表示法。For example, 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF is the little-endian hexadecimal representation of either -1,000,000 or 4,293,967,296. 因為此陣列中的最後一個位元組的最大顯著性位元上，會由解譯的位元組陣列值-1,000,000 為建構函式。Because the most significant bit of the last byte in this array is on, the value of the byte array would be interpreted by the constructor as -1,000,000. 若要具現化其值為正數，位元組陣列，其元素為 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 0x00 必須傳遞給建構函式。To instantiate a whose value is positive, a byte array whose elements are 0xC0 0xBD 0xF0 0xFF 0x00 must be passed to the constructor. 下列範例將說明這點。The following example illustrates this. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#3)] 所建立的位元組陣列正值方法包含此額外的零值的位元組。Byte arrays created by the method from positive values include this extra zero-value byte. 因此，結構可以成功地反覆存取值所指派，然後將它們還原從位元組陣列，如下列範例所示。Therefore, the structure can successfully round-trip values by assigning them to, and then restoring them from, byte arrays, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#4)] 不過，您可能需要將此額外的零值位元組至位元組陣列，動態地建立開發人員，或將不帶正負號的整數轉換成位元組陣列的方法所傳回的 (例如， ，和)。However, you may need to add this additional zero-value byte to byte arrays that are created dynamically by the developer or that are returned by methods that convert unsigned integers to byte arrays (such as , , and ). 剖析十六進位的字串，當和方法會假設，如果字串中的第一個位元組的最大顯著性位元設定，或如果字串的第一個十六進位數字表示較低的四位元的位元組值，這個值是表示使用二補數表示。When parsing a hexadecimal string, the and methods assume that if the most significant bit of the first byte in the string is set, or if the first hexadecimal digit of the string represents the lower four bits of a byte value, the value is represented by using two's complement representation. 例如，"FF01"和"F01 」 代表-255 的十進位值。For example, both "FF01" and "F01" represent the decimal value -255. 若要區分正從負數值，正值應該包含前置零。To differentiate positive from negative values, positive values should include a leading zero. 相關的多載方法，傳遞"X"格式字串時加入前置零的正數值傳回十六進位的字串。The relevant overloads of the method, when they are passed the "X" format string, add a leading zero to the returned hexadecimal string for positive values. 這使得來回使用的值和方法，如下列範例所示。This makes it possible to round-trip values by using the and methods, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples.vb#5)] 不過，將十六進位字串建立藉由呼叫`ToString`其他整數型別或多載的方法方法，包括`toBase`參數並不表示正負號的值或從其來源資料類型衍生的十六進位字串。However, the hexadecimal strings created by calling the `ToString` methods of the other integral types or the overloads of the method that include a `toBase` parameter do not indicate the sign of the value or the source data type from which the hexadecimal string was derived. 已成功具現化從這類字串的值需要某些額外邏輯。Successfully instantiating a value from such a string requires some additional logic. 下列範例提供一個可能的實作。The following example provides one possible implementation. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/cs/ByteAndHex_Examples2.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Class.ByteAndHex/vb/ByteAndHex_Examples2.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的個別位元組`value`陣列應該是位元組由小到大順序，從最低順序最高序位位元組的位元組。The individual bytes in the `value` array should be in little-endian order, from lowest-order byte to highest-order byte. 例如，數值 1,000,000,000,000 表示下表所示：For example, the numeric value 1,000,000,000,000 is represented as shown in the following table: ||| |-|-| |十六進位字串Hexadecimal string|E8D4A51000E8D4A51000| |位元組陣列 （第一次最低索引）Byte array (lowest index first)|00 10 A5 D4 E8 0000 10 A5 D4 E8 00| 大部分的方法，例如將數值轉換成位元組陣列，請和，以位元組由小到大的順序傳回位元組陣列。Most methods that convert numeric values to byte arrays, such as and , return byte arrays in little-endian order. 建構函式會預期要有正數值来使用標誌大小表示法，而負數的值来使用二補數表示的位元組陣列。The constructor expects positive values in the byte array to use sign-and-magnitude representation, and negative values to use two's complement representation. 換句話說，如果最高順序位元中的最高序位位元組`value`設定，產生值為負數。In other words, if the highest-order bit of the highest-order byte in `value` is set, the resulting value is negative. 根據位元組陣列的來源，這可能會導致正值以被錯誤解譯為負數值。Depending on the source of the byte array, this may cause a positive value to be misinterpreted as a negative value. 位元組陣列通常是透過下列方式產生：Byte arrays are typically generated in the following ways: - 藉由呼叫方法。By calling the method. 因為這個方法會傳回最高序位位元組的最高序位位元的位元組陣列中的陣列設定為零的正數值，絕不會發生的錯誤解譯為否定是正數值。Because this method returns a byte array with the highest-order bit of the highest-order byte in the array set to zero for positive values, there is no chance of misinterpreting a positive value as negative. 未修改的方式所建立的位元組陣列方法永遠成功地反覆存取時傳遞至建構函式。Unmodified byte arrays created by the method always successfully round-trip when they are passed to the constructor. - 藉由呼叫方法，並將其做為參數傳遞的帶正負號的整數。By calling the method and passing it a signed integer as a parameter. 帶正負號的整數處理標誌大小表示和二補數表示法，因為沒有可能的錯誤解譯為否定是正數值。Because signed integers handle both sign-and-magnitude representation and two's complement representation, there is no chance of misinterpreting a positive value as negative. - 藉由呼叫方法，並將其做為參數傳遞的不帶正負號的整數。By calling the method and passing it an unsigned integer as a parameter. 因為其大小只表示不帶正負號的整數，正值可以被錯誤解譯為負數值。Because unsigned integers are represented by their magnitude only, positive values can be misinterpreted as negative values. 若要避免這個錯誤解譯，您可以將零位元組的值加入陣列結尾。To prevent this misinterpretation, you can add a zero-byte value to the end of the array. 下一節中的範例提供說明。The example in the next section provides an illustration. - 藉由建立位元組陣列可能動態或靜態方式不一定呼叫任何先前的方法，或是藉由修改現有的位元組陣列。By creating a byte array either dynamically or statically without necessarily calling any of the previous methods, or by modifying an existing byte array. 若要避免正值會錯誤解譯為負數值，您可以將零位元組的值加入陣列結尾。To prevent positive values from being misinterpreted as negative values, you can add a zero-byte value to the end of the array. 如果`value`為空array，新物件會初始化為值。If `value` is an empty array, the new object is initialized to a value of . 如果`value`已`null`，建構函式會擲回。If `value` is `null`, the constructor throws an . ## Examples 下列範例會具現化{5，4，3，2，1}，其值是 5 個元素位元組陣列中的物件。The following example instantiates a object from a 5-element byte array whose value is {5, 4, 3, 2, 1}. 然後它會顯示值，表示為十進位和十六進位數字，到主控台。It then displays the value, represented as both decimal and hexadecimal numbers, to the console. 輸入陣列的文字輸出的比較可以清楚為什麼的這個多載類別建構函式建立物件，其值為 4328719365 （或 0x102030405）。A comparison of the input array with the text output makes it clear why this overload of the class constructor creates a object whose value is 4328719365 (or 0x102030405). 位元組陣列，其值為 5，第一個項目定義的最低序位位元組值物件，它是 0x05:sp。The first element of the byte array, whose value is 5, defines the value of the lowest-order byte of the object, which is 0x05. 位元組陣列，其值為 4，第二個項目定義的第二個位元組的值物件，也就是 0x04，依此類推。The second element of the byte array, whose value is 4, defines the value of the second byte of the object, which is 0x04, and so on. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#1)] 下列範例會具現化正和負值，請將它們傳遞至方法，然後還原原始產生的位元組陣列中的值。The following example instantiates a positive and a negative value, passes them to the method, and then restores the original values from the resulting byte array. 請注意兩個值都由相同的位元組陣列。Note that the two values are represented by identical byte arrays. 兩者之間唯一的差別是在最大顯著性位元的位元組陣列中的最後一個元素。The only difference between them is in the most significant bit of the last element in the byte array. 此位元會設定 （位元組的值是 0xFF），如果陣列從負建立值。This bit is set (the value of the byte is 0xFF) if the array is created from a negative value. 位元未設定 （位元組的值為零），如果陣列從正建立值。The bit is not set (the value of the byte is zero), if the array is created from a positive value. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#2)] 下列範例說明如何確認，正值會不正確具現化為負值加上其值為陣列結尾的零位元組。The following example illustrates how to make sure that a positive value is not incorrectly instantiated as a negative value by adding a byte whose value is zero to the end of the array. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example1.vb#3)]

[!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/cs/Example2.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ctors/vb/Example2.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 任何小數部分`value`具現化時，參數會被截斷物件。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated when instantiating a object. 因為缺少有效位數資料型別，呼叫這個建構函式可能會導致資料遺失。Because of the lack of precision of the data type, calling this constructor can cause data loss. 由呼叫這個建構函式產生的值等於值所產生明確指派值。The value that results from calling this constructor is identical to the value that results from explicitly assigning a value to a . ## Examples 下列範例示範如何將建構函式來具現化物件。The following example illustrates the use of the constructor to instantiate a object. 它也會說明當您使用時，可能會發生的精確度遺失的資料型別。It also illustrates the loss of precision that may occur when you use the data type. A指派較大的值，然後指派給物件。A is assigned a large value, which is then assigned to a object. 如輸出所示，這個作業牽涉到遺失有效位數。As the output shows, this assignment involves a loss of precision. 這兩個值則是以 1 遞增。Both values are then incremented by one. 輸出顯示物件會反映變更的值，而物件則否。The output shows that the object reflects the changed value, whereas the object does not. remarks.format: ## Remarks 具現化時不會遺失任何精確度的使用這個建構函式的物件。There is no loss of precision when instantiating a object by using this constructor. 由呼叫這個建構函式產生的值完全相同的值所產生的指派值。The value that results from calling this constructor is identical to the value that results from assigning an value to a . 結構不包含的型別參數的建構函式， ， ，或。The structure does not include constructors with a parameter of type , , , or . 不過，型別支援 8 位元和 16 位元帶正負號和不帶正負號的整數隱含轉換為帶正負號的 32 位元整數。However, the type supports the implicit conversion of 8-bit and 16-bit signed and unsigned integers to signed 32-bit integers. 如果，如此一來，呼叫這個建構函式`value`是這四個整數類資料類型的任何一個。As a result, this constructor is called if `value` is any one of these four integral types. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫建構函式來具現化32 位元整數的陣列中的值。The following example calls the constructor to instantiate values from an array of 32-bit integers. 它也會使用隱含轉換將每個 32 位元整數值指派給變數。It also uses implicit conversion to assign each 32-bit integer value to a variable. 然後它會比較兩個值來建立產生值都相同。It then compares the two values to establish that the resulting values are the same. returns.span: 和 的最大公因數。

span.span: The greatest common divisor of and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 最大公因數是最大的數字，其中兩個可以分割成的值，而不會傳回餘數。The greatest common divisor is the largest number into which the two values can be divided without returning a remainder. 如果`left`和`right`參數為非零的數字，此方法一律會傳回最小值為 1，因為所有數字除以 1。If the `left` and `right` parameters are non-zero numbers, the method always returns at least a value of 1 because all numbers can be divided by 1. 如果其中一個參數為零，則方法會傳回非零參數的絕對值。If either parameter is zero, the method returns the absolute value of the non-zero parameter. 如果這兩個值都是零，則該方法會傳回零。If both values are zero, the method returns zero. > [!NOTE] > 運算的很大的值的最大公因數`left`和`right`可以是非常耗時的作業。Computing the greatest common divisor of very large values of `left` and `right` can be a very time-consuming operation. 所傳回的值方法一律是正數的正負號不論`left`和`right`參數。The value returned by the method is always positive regardless of the sign of the `left` and `right` parameters. ## Examples 下列範例說明呼叫方法和例外狀況處理所需的實用資訊提供有關。The following example illustrates a call to the method and the exception handling necessary to provide useful information about an . 結果會指出這兩個數字的最大公因數是 1。The result indicates that the greatest common divisor of these two numbers is 1. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#10)]

[!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Log#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.biginteger.log/cs/log1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Log#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.numerics.biginteger.log/vb/log1.vb#1)] 這個方法會對應至基本數值類型的方法。This method corresponds to the method for the primitive numeric types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`和`baseValue`參數會指定做為基底 10 的數字。The `value` and `baseValue` parameters are specified as base 10 numbers. 精確傳回方法的值而定的符號`value`正負號和值在`baseValue`，如下表所示。The precise return value of the method depends on the sign of `value` and on the sign and value of `baseValue`, as the following table shows. |`value` 參數`value` parameter|`baseValue` 參數`baseValue` parameter|傳回值Return value| |-----------------------|---------------------------|------------------| |`value` > 0`value` > 0|(0 < `baseValue` < 1) -or-(`baseValue` > 1)(0 < `baseValue` < 1) -or-(`baseValue` > 1)|logbaseValue(`value`)logbaseValue(`value`)| |`value` < 0`value` < 0|(任意值)(any value)|| |(任意值)(any value)|`baseValue` < 0`baseValue` < 0|| |`value` != 1`value` != 1|`baseValue` = 0`baseValue` = 0|| |`value` != 1`value` != 1|`baseValue` = || |(任意值)(any value)|`baseValue` = || |(任意值)(any value)|`baseValue` = 1`baseValue` = 1|| |`value` = 0`value` = 0|0 < `baseValue` < 10 < `baseValue` < 1|| |`value` = 0`value` = 0|`baseValue` > 1`baseValue` > 1|| |`value` = 1`value` = 1|`baseValue` = 0`baseValue` = 0|00| |`value` = 1`value` = 1|`baseValue` = |00| 若要計算的基底 10 對數值，請呼叫方法。To calculate the base 10 logarithm of a value, call the method. 若要計算數字的自然對數，呼叫方法。To calculate the natural logarithm of a number, call the method. 這個方法會對應至基本數值類型的方法。This method corresponds to the method for the primitive numeric types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法的實作不支援運算子多載的語言。The method is implemented for languages that do not support operator overloading. 它的行為等同於使用乘法運算子的乘法。Its behavior is identical to multiplication using the multiplication operator. 颾魤 ㄛ具現化時，方法是乘法運算子的有用替代變數指派給產品所產生的乘法，如下列範例所示。In addition, the method is a useful substitute for the multiplication operator when instantiating a variable by assigning it a product that results from multiplication, as shown in the following example. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/cs/Multiply1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/vb/Multiply1.vb#1)] 如果有必要，這個方法會自動執行的其他整數類資料類型的隱含轉換物件。If necessary, this method automatically performs implicit conversion of other integral types to objects. 在下一步 區段中，此範例所示所在方法會傳遞兩個值。This is illustrated in the example in the next section, where the method is passed two values. ## Examples 下列範例會嘗試執行乘法與兩個長整數。The following example tries to perform multiplication with two long integers. 結果超出範圍的長整數，因為就會擲回，而呼叫方法來處理乘法運算。Because the result exceeds the range of a long integer, an is thrown, and the method is called to handle the multiplication. 請注意，C# 需要使用任何一種`checked`關鍵字 （如此範例所示） 或`/checked+`編譯器選項，請確定在數值溢位上擲回例外狀況。Note that C# requires that you use either the `checked` keyword (as in this example) or the `/checked+` compiler option to make sure an exception is thrown on a numeric overflow. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 否定取得數字的加法反元素。Negation obtains the additive inverse of a number. 數字的加法反元素為它新增至原始的數字時，會產生值為零的數字。The additive inverse of a number is a number that produces a value of zero when it is added to the original number. 方法的實作不支援自訂運算子的語言。The method is implemented for languages that do not support custom operators. 它的行為等同於使用一元負運算子的否定運算。Its behavior is identical to negation using the unary negation operator. 颾魤 ㄛ具現化時，方法是負運算子的有用替代變數，如下列範例所示。In addition, the method is a useful substitute for the negation operator when instantiating a variable, as shown in the following example. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/cs/Multiply1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.OperationMethods/vb/Multiply1.vb#4)] ## Examples 下列範例說明要變換正負號的值的三種方式物件。The following example illustrates three ways to negate the value of a object. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定義的位元`And`作業值。The method defines the bitwise `And` operation for values. 位元`And`作業會設定結果位元只有當對應的位元`left`和`right`也設定下, 表所示。The bitwise `And` operation sets a result bit only if the corresponding bits in `left` and `right` are also set, as shown in the following table. |位元 `left`Bit in `left`|位元 `right`Bit in `right`|在結果中的位元Bit in result| |-------------------|--------------------|-------------------| |00|00|00| |11|00|00| |11|11|11| |00|11|00| 方法可讓程式碼，如下所示：The method enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/Operator1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#1)] 方法會執行位元`And`對兩個作業值如同它們是在二補數具有表示虛擬的正負號擴充。The method performs the bitwise `And` operation on two values as if they were both in two's complement representation with virtual sign extension.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 結果的位元互斥`Or`作業`true`如果兩個位元的值不同，否則為，則是`false`。The result of a bitwise exclusive `Or` operation is `true` if the values of the two bits are different; otherwise, it is `false`. 下表說明專用`Or`作業。The following table illustrates the exclusive `Or` operation. |中的位元 x `left`Bit x in `left`|中的位元 x `right`Bit x in `right`|傳回值Return value| |---------------------|----------------------|------------------| |00|00|00| |00|11|11| |11|00|11| |11|11|00| 方法可讓程式碼，如下所示：The method enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/Operator1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#8)] 方法會執行位元互斥`Or`對兩個作業值如同它們是在二補數具有表示虛擬的正負號擴充。The method performs the bitwise exclusive `Or` operation on two values as if they were both in two's complement representation with virtual sign extension.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 任何小數部分`value`轉換前的參數會被截斷。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated before conversion. 多載方法定義的類型，其中或從中物件可以轉換。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 因為從轉換要可能是截斷的任何小數部分`value`，語言編譯器不要自動執行這項轉換。Because the conversion from to can involve truncating any fractional part of `value`, language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically. 相反地，它們執行轉換 （在 C# 中) 轉型運算子或轉換函式時，才可以 (例如`CType`Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` in Visual Basic) is used. 否則，它們會顯示編譯器錯誤。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 不支援自訂運算子的語言，另一種方法是。For languages that do not support custom operators, the alternative method is . ## Examples 下列範例會將陣列中的個別項目值來物件，並接著會顯示每個轉換的結果。The following example converts the individual elements in an array of values to objects, and then displays the result of each conversion. 請注意，任何小數部分的在轉換期間截斷值。Note that any fractional part of a value is truncated during the conversion. span.span: The value to convert to a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 多載方法定義的類型，其中或從中物件可以轉換。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 語言編譯器不會執行這項轉換會自動因為它可能會遺失資料。Language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically because it can involve data loss. 相反地，它們執行轉換 （在 C# 中) 轉型運算子或轉換函式時，才可以 (例如`CType`或`CByte`Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` or `CByte` in Visual Basic) is used. 否則，它們會顯示編譯器錯誤。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 由於這項作業定義的縮小轉換，仍會擲回如果在執行階段的值超出範圍資料型別。Because this operation defines a narrowing conversion, it can throw an at run time if the value is outside the range of the data type. 不會在產生的有效位數遺失任何值，如果轉換成功。There is no loss of precision in the resulting value if the conversion is successful. ## Examples 下列範例說明轉換至值。The following example illustrates the conversion of to values. 它也會處理因為擲回的值超出範圍資料型別。It also handles an that is thrown because the value is outside the range of the data type. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Explicit#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Explicit/cs/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Explicit.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Explicit#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Explicit/vb/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Explicit.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 多載方法定義的類型，其中或從中物件可以轉換。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 語言編譯器不會執行這項轉換會自動因為它可能會遺失資料。Language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically because it can involve data loss. 相反地，它們執行轉換 （在 C# 中) 轉型運算子或轉換函式時，才可以 (例如`CType`或`CDbl`Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` or `CDbl` in Visual Basic) is used. 因為值可以是範圍之外的資料類型，這項作業是縮小轉換。Because the value can be outside the range of the data type, this operation is a narrowing conversion. 如果轉換失敗，它不會擲回。If the conversion is unsuccessful, it does not throw an . 相反地，如果值是小於，產生的值是。Instead, if the value is less than , the resulting value is . 如果值大於，產生的值是。If the value is greater than , the resulting value is . 轉換至可能會遺失有效位數。The conversion of a to a may involve a loss of precision. 在某些情況下，遺失有效位數可能會導致成功轉型或轉換作業即使的值超出範圍資料型別。In some cases, the loss of precision may cause the casting or conversion operation to succeed even if the value is outside the range of the data type. 下列範例提供一個實例。The following example provides an illustration. 它會將指派的最大值有兩個變數，會遞增一個9.999e291，然後測試是否相等的兩個變數的變數。It assigns the maximum value of a to two variables, increments one variable by 9.999e291, and tests the two variables for equality. 如預期般呼叫方法會顯示不相等。As expected, the call to the method shows that they are unequal. 不過，較大的轉換值反向成功，雖然值現在超過。However, the conversion of the larger value back to a succeeds, although the value now exceeds . remarks.format: ## Remarks 多載方法定義的類型，其中或從中物件可以轉換。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 語言編譯器不會執行這項轉換會自動因為它可能會遺失資料。Language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically because it can involve data loss. 相反地，它們執行轉換 （在 C# 中) 轉型運算子或轉換函式時，才可以 (例如`CType`或`CUShort`Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` or `CUShort` in Visual Basic) is used. 否則，它們會顯示編譯器錯誤。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 由於這項作業定義的縮小轉換，仍會擲回如果在執行階段的值超出範圍資料型別。Because this operation defines a narrowing conversion, it can throw an at run time if the value is outside the range of the data type. 不會在產生的有效位數遺失任何值，如果轉換成功。There is no loss of precision in the resulting value if the conversion is successful. ## Examples 下列範例說明轉換至值。The following example illustrates the conversion of to values. 它也會處理因為擲回的值超出範圍資料型別。It also handles an that is thrown because the value is outside the range of the data type. remarks.format: ## Remarks 任何小數部分`value`轉換前的參數會被截斷。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated before conversion. 多載方法定義的類型，其中或從中物件可以轉換。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a object can be converted. 因為從轉換要可能是截斷的任何小數部分`value`，語言編譯器不要自動執行這項轉換。Because the conversion from to can involve truncating any fractional part of `value`, language compilers do not perform this conversion automatically. 相反地，它們執行轉換 （在 C# 中) 轉型運算子或轉換函式時，才可以 (例如`CType`Visual Basic 中) 使用。Instead, they perform the conversion only if a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (such as `CType` in Visual Basic) is used. 否則，它們會顯示編譯器錯誤。Otherwise, they display a compiler error. 不支援自訂運算子的語言，另一種方法是。For languages that do not support custom operators, the alternative method is . ## Examples 下列範例會將陣列中的個別項目值來物件，並接著會顯示每個轉換的結果。The following example converts the individual elements in an array of values to objects, and then displays the result of each conversion. 請注意，任何小數部分的在轉換期間截斷值。Note that any fractional part of a value is truncated during the conversion. remarks.format: ## Remarks 任何小數部分`value`轉換前的參數會被截斷。Any fractional part of the `value` parameter is truncated before conversion. 不支援隱含運算子的語言，另一種方法是。For languages that do not support implicit operators, the alternative method is . 多載方法會定義類型，或從自動轉換編譯器可以而不需要明確轉型運算子 （在 C# 中) 或 （在 Visual Basic) 的轉換函式呼叫的值。The overloads of the method define the types to which or from which a compiler can automatically convert a value without an explicit casting operator (in C#) or a call to a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 它們擴展轉換不會涉及資料遺失，並不會擲回。They are widening conversions that do not involve data loss and do not throw an . 這個多載可讓編譯器處理從不值值，如下列範例所示。This overload lets the compiler handle conversions from a value to a value, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定義的遞增作業值。The method defines the increment operation for values. 它可讓程式碼，如下所示：It enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#24](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/cs/BigInteger_Examples.cs#24)] 某些語言 （例如 Visual Basic) 缺少遞增運算子，或不支援運算子多載可以呼叫方法直接，如下列範例所示。Some languages (such as Visual Basic) that lack an increment operator or do not support operator overloading can call the method directly, as the following example shows. [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Class#25](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Class/vb/BigInteger_Examples.vb#25)] 因為物件是不可變的運算子會建立新物件，其值為一個以上所表示的物件`value`。Because objects are immutable, the operator creates a new object whose value is one more than the object represented by `value`. 因此，重複呼叫可能很昂貴。Therefore, repeated calls to may be expensive. 這個運算子的對等方法是。The equivalent method for this operator is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法定義的位元左移運算子操作值。The method defines the operation of the bitwise left-shift operator for values. 它可讓程式碼，如下所示：It enables code such as the following: [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#29](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/cs/Operator1.cs#29)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators#29](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Operators/vb/Operator1.vb#29)] > [!NOTE] > 不同位元左移運算與整數基本項目中，於方法會保留原始的正負號值。Unlike the bitwise left-shift operation with integer primitives, the method preserves the sign of the original value. 不支援自訂運算子的語言可以執行位元左移運算，乘以`value`由`BigInteger.Pow(2, shift)`。Languages that do not support custom operators can perform a bitwise left-shift operation by multiplying `value` by `BigInteger.Pow(2, shift)`. 下列範例示範結果會使用這個運算子的結果相同。The following example shows that the results are identical to the results of using this operator. remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`參數應該是下列格式之數字的字串表示。The `value` parameter should be the string representation of a number in the following form. [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字順序。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 任何前置的零都會被忽略。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`value`參數會解譯使用樣式。The string specified by the `value` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 它不能包含任何的群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且不得有小數部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `value`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中初始化目前系統文化特性的物件。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要將字串剖析使用特定文化特性格式資訊，請使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of a specific culture, use the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果您使用方法，以往返的字串表示的所輸出的值方法，您應該使用使用"R"格式規範，以產生的字串表示的方法值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否則的字串表示法會保留 50 的原始值和資料的最高有效位數時可能會遺失您使用僅方法，以還原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法具現化兩個物件。The following example uses the method to instantiate two objects. 乘以每個物件，另一個數字，然後再呼叫方法，以判斷兩個值之間的關聯性。It multiplies each object by another number and then calls the method to determine the relationship between the two values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/cs/Parse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/vb/Parse1.vb#1)]

span.span: is .
is not in the correct format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `style`參數定義中允許的樣式項目 （例如空白字元、 正數或負數符號、 群組分隔符號或小數點符號）`value`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space, the positive or negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `value` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `styles` 必須是從位元旗標組合列舉型別。`styles` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`參數可讓這個方法多載有用的時機`value`包含十六進位值的字串表示，當所表示之數字系統，（十進位或十六進位）`value`已知只能在執行階段，或當您不允許空白字元，或登符號在`value`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `value` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `value` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `value`. 值而定`style`，則`value`參數可能包括下列項目：Depending on the value of `style`, the `value` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`包含，則`value`參數可能包含下列項目：If `style` includes , the `value` parameter may contain the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`value`如果`style`包含旗標，也可以顯示在結尾`value`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義和目前文化特性的屬性。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the current culture. 目前的文化特性的貨幣符號會出現在`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`value`如果`style`包含旗標，也可以顯示在結尾`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the flag. 可用於括號`value`表示負值`style`包含旗標。Parentheses can be used in `value` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*

*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*

*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. 針對*fractional_digits*，只有數字 0 是有效。For *fractional_digits*, only the digit 0 is valid.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的群組分隔符號。A culture-specific group separator symbol. 目前的文化特性的群組分隔符號可以出現在`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's group separator can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 目前的文化特性的貨幣符號會出現在`value`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `value` if `style` includes the flag. 只是數字 0 會顯示為小數位數的剖析作業才會成功;如果*fractional_digits*包含任何其他數字，就會擲回。Only the digit 0 can appear as a fractional digit for the parse operation to succeed; if *fractional_digits* includes any other digit, a is thrown.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字元，表示代表的值時，會以指數 （科學記號） 標記法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `value`參數可代表指數標記法之數字，如果`style`包含旗標。The `value` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|一連串的從 0 到 f 或 0 到 f 的十六進位數字A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| > [!NOTE] > 中的任何終止 NUL (u+0000) 字元`s`剖析作業中，不論值會忽略`style`引數。Any terminating NUL (U+0000) characters in `s` are ignored by the parsing operation, regardless of the value of the `style` argument. 只有數字的字串 (對應至樣式) 一律會成功剖析。A string with digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 大部分的其餘成員控制可能存在，但不是一定要出現在輸入字串的項目。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in the input string. 下表指出如何個別成員會影響可能會出現在項目`value`。The following table indicates how individual members affect the elements that may be present in `value`. |`NumberStyles` 值`NumberStyles` value|中的項目允許`value`除了數字Elements permitted in `value` in addition to digits| |--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------| ||*數字*只有項目。The *digits* element only.| ||小數點 （.） 及*小數位數*項目。The decimal point (.) and *fractional-digits* elements.| ||"E"或"E"字元，這表示指數標記法，連同*exponential_digits*。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates exponential notation, along with *exponential_digits*.| ||*Ws*開頭的項目`value`。The *ws* element at the start of `value`.| ||*Ws*結尾的項目`value`。The *ws* element at the end of `value`.| ||*號*開頭的項目`value`。The *sign* element at the start of `value`.| ||*號*結尾的項目`value`。The *sign* element at the end of `value`.| ||*號*括號括住的數字值的形式的項目。The *sign* element in the form of parentheses enclosing the numeric value.| ||群組分隔符號 （，） 項目。The group separator (,) element.| ||貨幣 （$） 的項目。The currency ($) element.| ||所有項目。All elements. 不過，`value`無法表示十六進位數字或指數標記法之數字。However, `value` cannot represent a hexadecimal number or a number in exponential notation.| ||*Ws*開頭或結尾的項目`value`，*登*開頭`value`，並在小數點 (*。*) 符號。The *ws* element at the start or end of `value`, *sign* at the start of `value`, and the decimal point (*.*) symbol. `value`參數也可以使用指數標記法。The `value` parameter can also use exponential notation.| ||`ws`， `sign`、 群組分隔符號 (*，*)，和小數點 (*。*) 項目。The `ws`, `sign`, group separator (*,*), and decimal point (*.*) elements.| ||所有項目。All elements. 不過，`value`無法代表十六進位數字。However, `value` cannot represent a hexadecimal number.| > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果您使用方法，以往返的字串表示的所輸出的值方法，您應該使用使用"R"格式規範，以產生的字串表示的方法值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否則的字串表示法會保留 50 的原始值和資料的最高有效位數時可能會遺失您使用僅方法，以還原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. 不同於其他的值，允許，但不是需要，在特定的樣式項目出現與否`value`，則樣式值表示，在個別的數字字元`value`一律會解譯為十六進位字元。Unlike the other values, which allow for, but do not require, the presence of particular style elements in `value`, the style value means that the individual numeric characters in `value` are always interpreted as hexadecimal characters. 有效的十六進位字元是 0-9、 A-F 和 a-f。Valid hexadecimal characters are 0-9, A-F, and a-f. 只有其他旗標，可以結合`style`參數都和。The only other flags that can be combined with the `style` parameter are and . (列舉會包含複合的數字樣式，其中包含這兩個空格旗標。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`value`的字串表示法的十六進位數字，它無法加上任何裝飾 (例如`0x`或`&h`)，區隔其為十六進位的數字。If `value` is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 這會導致轉換失敗。This causes the conversion to fail. 如果`value`是十六進位字串，方法會解譯`value`為負數儲存透過其前兩個十六進位數字是否大於或等於二補數表示`0x80`。If `value` is a hexadecimal string, the method interprets `value` as a negative number stored by using two's complement representation if its first two hexadecimal digits are greater than or equal to `0x80`. 換句話說，此方法會解譯中的第一個位元組的最高序位位元`value`為正負號位元。In other words, the method interprets the highest-order bit of the first byte in `value` as the sign bit. 若要確定為正數中的第一個數字會正確解譯為十六進位字串`value`必須具有值為零。To make sure that a hexadecimal string is correctly interpreted as a positive number, the first digit in `value` must have a value of zero. 比方說，此方法會將解譯`0x80`為負數值，但它會解譯其中一個`0x080`或`0x0080`為正值。For example, the method interprets `0x80` as a negative value, but it interprets either `0x080` or `0x0080` as a positive value. 下列範例說明十六進位的字串代表負數和正數的值之間的差異。The following example illustrates the difference between hexadecimal strings that represent negative and positive values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/cs/ParseHex1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/vb/ParseHex1.vb#3)] `value`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中初始化目前系統文化特性的物件。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 若要指定的文化特性的格式資訊用於剖析作業，請呼叫多載。To specify the culture whose formatting information is used for the parse operation, call the overload. ## Examples 下列範例說明如何呼叫方法有數個可能的值為`style`參數。The following example illustrates calls to the method with several possible values for the `style` parameter. 它說明如何將字串解譯為十六進位值時，以及如何不允許空格和登入的符號。It illustrates how to interpret a string as a hexadecimal value, and how to disallow spaces and sign symbols. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/cs/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/vb/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`參數應該是下列格式之數字的字串表示：The `value` parameter should be the string representation of a number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由並的屬性所傳回的物件`provider`物件的方法。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the object that is returned by the `provider` object's method.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字順序。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 任何前置的零都會被忽略。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`value`參數會解譯使用樣式。The string specified by the `value` parameter is interpreted using the style. 它不能包含任何的群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且不得有小數部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果您使用方法，以往返的字串表示的所輸出的值方法，您應該使用使用"R"格式規範，以產生的字串表示的方法值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否則的字串表示法會保留 50 的原始值和資料的最高有效位數時可能會遺失您使用僅方法，以還原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. `provider`參數是實作其方法會傳回提供特定文化特性格式資訊的物件。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific formatting information. 當叫用方法時，它會呼叫`provider`參數的方法並將它傳遞物件，表示型別。When the method is invoked, it calls the `provider` parameter's method and passes it a object that represents the type. 方法接著會傳回物件，提供格式的相關資訊`value`參數。The method then returns the object that provides information about the format of the `value` parameter. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供自訂格式化剖析作業資訊：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 您可以傳遞物件，表示提供的格式資訊的文化特性。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供用於該文化特性的數值格式資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 您可以傳遞的實際提供數值格式資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (其實作的只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞自訂物件實作。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`已`null`的格式化`value`解譯根據目前文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of `value` is interpreted based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示兩種方式可定義波狀符號 （~） 為格式化的負號值。The following examples show two ways to define the tilde (~) as a negative sign for formatting values. 請注意，顯示相同的格式為原始字串中的值，您的程式碼必須呼叫方法並將它傳遞提供格式設定資訊的物件。Note that to display the values in the same format as the original strings, your code must call the method and pass it the object that provides formatting information. 第一個範例中定義類別可實作並用方法來傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。The first example defines a class that implements and uses the method to return the object that provides formatting information. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/cs/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/vb/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.vb#2)] A可以然後具現化物件為下列程式碼：A object can then be instantiated with the following code: [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/cs/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/vb/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.vb#3)] 第二個範例是更簡單。The second example is more straightforward. 它會傳遞物件，提供格式設定資訊給`provider`參數。It passes the object that provides formatting information to the `provider` parameter. [!code-csharp[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/cs/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse/vb/System.Numeric.BigInteger.Parse.vb#4)]

[*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[*.fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[*.fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 如果`style`包含，則`value`參數可能包括下列項目：If `style` includes , the `value` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`value`如果`style`包含旗標，也可以顯示在結尾`value`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the start of `value` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `value` if `style` includes the parsing operation, regardless of the value of the `style` argument. 只有數字的字串 (對應至樣式) 一律會成功剖析。A string with digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 大部分的其餘成員控制可能存在，但不是一定要出現在輸入字串的項目。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in the input string. 下表指出如何個別成員會影響可能會出現在項目`value`。The following the start or end of `value`, *sign* at the start of `value`, and the decimal point (.) symbol. `value`參數也可以使用指數標記法。The `value` parameter can also use exponential notation.| ||`ws`， `sign`、 群組分隔符號 （、）、 和小數點 （.） 項目。The `ws`, `sign`, group separator (,), and decimal point (.) elements.| ||所有項目。All elements. 不過，`value`無法代表十六進位數字。However, `value` cannot represent a hexadecimal number.| > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果您使用方法，以往返的字串表示的所輸出的值方法，您應該使用使用"R"格式規範，以產生的字串表示的方法值。If you use the method to round-trip the string representation of a value that was output by the method, you should use the method with the "R" format specifier to generate the string representation of the value. 否則的字串表示法會保留 50 的原始值和資料的最高有效位數時可能會遺失您使用僅方法，以還原值。Otherwise, the string representation of the preserves only the 50 most significant digits of the original value, and data may be lost when you use the method to restore the value. 不同於其他的值，允許，但不是需要特定的 style 項目出現與否`value`，則樣式值表示，在個別的數字字元`value`一律會解譯為十六進位字元。Unlike the other values, which allow for but do not require the presence of particular style elements in `value`, the style value means that the individual numeric characters in `value` are always interpreted as hexadecimal characters. 有效的十六進位字元是 0-9、 A-F 和 a-f。Valid hexadecimal characters are 0-9, A-F, and a-f. 只有其他旗標，可以結合`style`參數都和。The only other flags that can be combined with the `style` parameter are and . (列舉會包含複合的數字樣式，其中包含這兩個空格旗標。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`value`的字串表示法的十六進位數字，它無法加上任何裝飾 (例如`0x`或`&h`)，區隔其為十六進位的數字。If `value` is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 這會導致轉換失敗。This causes the conversion to fail. 如果`value`是十六進位字串，方法會解譯`value`為負數儲存透過其前兩個十六進位數字是否大於或等於二補數表示`0x80`。If `value` is a hexadecimal string, the method interprets `value` as a negative number stored by using two's complement representation if its first two hexadecimal digits are greater than or equal to `0x80`. 換句話說，此方法會解譯中的第一個位元組的最高序位位元`value`為正負號位元。In other words, the method interprets the highest-order bit of the first byte in `value` as the sign bit. 若要確定為正數中的第一個數字會正確解譯為十六進位字串`value`必須具有值為零。To make sure that a hexadecimal string is correctly interpreted as a positive number, the first digit in `value` must have a value of zero. 比方說，此方法會將解譯`0x80`為負數值，但它會解譯其中一個`0x080`或`0x0080`為正值。For example, the method interprets `0x80` as a negative value, but it interprets either `0x080` or `0x0080` as a positive value. 下列範例說明十六進位的字串代表負數和正數的值之間的差異。The following example illustrates the difference between hexadecimal strings that represent negative and positive values. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/cs/ParseHex1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/vb/ParseHex1.vb#3)] `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回物件，提供特定文化特性格式資訊`value`。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 一般而言，`provider`可以是下列任一項：Typically, `provider` can be any one of the following: - A物件，表示提供數值格式資訊的文化特性。A object that represents the culture that provides numeric formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供數值格式資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information. - A提供格式設定資訊的物件。A object that provides formatting information. (其實作的只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 自訂物件實作並用方法來具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。A custom object that implements and uses the method to instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`已`null`，則物件會使用目前的文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例使數次呼叫方法使用的值的各種組合`style`和`provider`參數。The following example makes several calls to the method using various combinations of values for the `style` and `provider` parameters. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/cs/Parse1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.Parse/vb/Parse1.vb#2)] 個別的呼叫數方法傳遞執行個體的下列`BigIntegerFormatProvider`類別，定義為負號的波狀符號 （~）。A number of the individual calls to the method pass an instance of the following `BigIntegerFormatProvider` class, which defines a tilde (~) as the negative sign. summary.span: 將 值轉換成位元組陣列。

span.span: Converts a value to a byte array.

returns.span: 目前 物件的值，已轉換為位元組陣列。

span.span: The value of the current object converted to an array of bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法所傳回陣列中個別的位元組由小到大順序出現。The individual bytes in the array returned by this method appear in little-endian order. 也就是低序位位元組值的前面的高序位位元組。That is, the lower-order bytes of the value precede the higher-order bytes. 陣列的第一個位元組會反映第一個八位元第二個位元組的值會反映，接下來的八個位元，依此類推。The first byte of the array reflects the first eight bits of the value, the second byte reflects the next eight bits, and so on. 例如，值為 1024 或 0x0400，儲存為下列兩個位元組的陣列：For example, the value 1024, or 0x0400, is stored as the following array of two bytes: |元素Element|位元組值Byte value| |-------------|----------------| |00|0x000x00| |11|0x040x04| 負值會寫入到陣列中的最精簡的格式可能使用二補數表示法。Negative values are written to the array using two's complement representation in the most compact form possible. 例如，-1 以其值是單一位元組`0xFF`而不是以多個項目時，陣列這類`0xFF`，`0xFF`或`0xFF`， `0xFF`， `0xFF`， `0xFF`。For example, -1 is represented as a single byte whose value is `0xFF` instead of as an array with multiple elements, such as `0xFF`, `0xFF` or `0xFF`, `0xFF`, `0xFF`, `0xFF`. 因為二補數表示一律會解譯陣列中的最後一個位元組的最高序位位元 (位置處的位元組 `- 1`) 做為正負號位元，方法會傳回額外的項目，其值為零的位元組陣列至釐清正數值，否則無法解譯為具有其正負號位元都設定。Because two's complement representation always interprets the highest-order bit of the last byte in the array (the byte at position `- 1`) as the sign bit, the method returns a byte array with an extra element whose value is zero to disambiguate positive values that could otherwise be interpreted as having their sign bits set. 比方說，120 的值或`0x78`表示為單一位元組陣列： `0x78`。For example, the value 120 or `0x78` is represented as a single-byte array: `0x78`. 不過，128，或是`0x80`，表示為兩個位元組陣列： `0x80`， `0x00`。However, 128, or `0x80`, is represented as a two-byte array: `0x80`, `0x00`. 您可以往返值，將其儲存為位元組陣列，然後再還原使用建構函式。You can round-trip a value by storing it to a byte array and then restoring it using the constructor. > [!CAUTION] > 如果您的程式碼修改個別陣列中的位元組之前它會還原值，這個方法所傳回的值，您必須確定，您不小心變更正負號位元。If your code modifies the value of individual bytes in the array returned by this method before it restores the value, you must make sure that you do not unintentionally change the sign bit. 例如，如果您修改增加正數值，使最高順序位元的位元組陣列的最後一個元素會變成設定，您可以加入新的位元組，其值為陣列結尾的零。For example, if your modifications increase a positive value so that the highest-order bit in the last element of the byte array becomes set, you can add a new byte whose value is zero to the end of the array. ## Examples 下列範例將說明一些值都表示位元組陣列。The following example illustrates how some values are represented in byte arrays. [!code-csharp[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray/cs/ToByteArray1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Numerics.BigInteger.ToByteArray/vb/ToByteArray1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中指定的格式，使用值物件，表示目前的文化特性的慣例。The method formats a value in a specified format by using a object that represents the conventions of the current culture. 如果您想要使用"R"或反覆存取時，格式化或指定不同的文化特性，請使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to use the "R", or round-trip, format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |Round-trip ("R") 格式Round-trip ("R") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| `format`參數可以是任何有效[標準數值字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或任何組合[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [custom numeric format strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等於是否`null`，目前的傳回值物件的格式使用來回行程格式規範 ("R")。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the round-trip format specifier ("R"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，則方法會擲回。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 會提供廣泛的格式化支援，這會在下列格式化主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)並[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需在.NET Framework 格式支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 傳回字串的格式取決於目前的文化特性的物件。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 取決於`format`參數，這個物件可控制例如負號、 群組分隔符號和小數點符號，輸出字串中的符號。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the negative sign, the group separator, and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供目前的文化特性以外的文化特性格式資訊，請呼叫多載。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下列範例會初始化值並將它顯示使用每個標準格式字串和一些自訂格式字串。The following example initializes a value and displays it by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)並[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需在.NET Framework 格式支援的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `provider`參數是實作。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法會傳回提供特定文化特性格式資訊的字串，這個方法所傳回的物件。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string returned by this method. 當叫用方法時，它會呼叫`provider`參數的方法並將它傳遞物件，表示型別。When the method is invoked, it calls the `provider` parameter's method and passes it a object that represents the type. 方法接著會傳回物件，提供格式化資訊`value`參數，例如負號、 群組分隔符號或小數點符號。The method then returns the object that provides information for formatting the `value` parameter, such as the negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol. 若要使用的三種方式`provider`參數來提供格式設定資訊給方法：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply formatting information to the method: - 您可以傳遞物件，表示提供的格式資訊的文化特性。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法會傳回提供用於該文化特性的數值格式資訊的物件。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 您可以傳遞的實際提供數值格式資訊的物件。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (其實作的只會傳回本身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 您可以傳遞自訂物件實作。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法具現化，並傳回提供格式設定資訊的物件。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`已`null`，傳回字串的格式根據目前文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下列範例會初始化值，並將它顯示到主控台使用的標準格式字串和波狀符號 （~） 中定義的負號的物件。The following example initializes a value, and displays it to the console using a standard format string and a object that defines the tilde (~) as a negative sign. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 這個方法就不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試如果`value`無效，無法成功剖析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `value` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `value`參數應該是以下列形式的十進位數字的字串表示：The `value` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性正負號。An optional sign. 有效的符號字元由和目前文化特性的屬性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的十進位數字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| > [!NOTE] > 所指定的字串`value`參數不能包含任何的群組分隔符號或小數分隔符號，而且它不能有小數部分。The string specified by the `value` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `value`參數會解譯使用樣式。The `value` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 除了十進位數字，只允許前置和尾端空格取代前置正負號。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 明確地定義使用中會有特定文化特性格式資訊的樣式項目`value`，呼叫方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `value`, call the method. `value`參數會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中目前的文化特性的物件。The `value` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 這個多載會解譯中的所有位數`value`參數做為十進位數字。This overload interprets all digits in the `value` parameter as decimal digits. 若要剖析的十六進位數字的字串表示，呼叫改為多載。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法具現化兩個物件。The following example uses the method to instantiate two objects. 如果轉換成功，乘以另一個數字的每個物件，然後再呼叫方法，以判斷兩個物件之間的關聯性。If the conversions succeed, it multiplies each object by another number and then calls the method to determine the relationship between the two objects.
